abstract: Justice Dept indicts four men in Singapore on charges of breaking American export-control laws by smuggling electronic parts made in Minnesota to Iran, where some of the devices ended up in makeshift bombs that were seized by American forces in Iraq.
snippet: Five suspects were charged with shipping Minnesota-made components, some found in unexploded bombs in Iraq, through Singapore.
lead_paragraph: Five suspects were charged with shipping Minnesota-made components, some found in unexploded bombs in Iraq, through Singapore.

headline.main: U.S. Parts Smuggled to Iran for Iraq Bombs, Charges Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Parts Smuggled to Iran For Iraq Bombs, Charges Say
headline.seo: U.S. Says Parts Smuggled to Iran, Some for I.E.D.’s in Iraq
